intro: Neurocarpaea purpurea, commonly known as the purple neurocarpaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale purple flowers. The leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. This plant is valued for its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
